text: okay, so what i am doing is i am listing to that song in a new window and browsing achewood. it makes for the best thing ever!!!!!!

text: This is pretty much the only thing i do when drunk.

name: macdaddyw
text: So do I, but usually its slightly less intentional.

name: zem
text: Teodor made a good guess. That probably would have been right on a different day.

name: closefriend
text: He would have been right about me at that age... if you double Philippe's age and change "pure vanilla extract" to "boullion cubes."

name: jack_samson
text: I disagree about the boullion cubes.  That vanilla extract though.  Shudder.

name: sigmacoder
text: Vanilla extract is nothing compared to root beer extract. x_x

name: norrin
text: I too tried the boullion cubes. I also ate a chunk of that concentrated chocolate they use to boil for hot chocolate. To this day, if I smell something similar it makes me nauseous.

name: zeal
text: I didn't try boullion cubes or vanilla extract, but there was a time when i didn't know what pepper was. Then I found a jar of it in the fridge, put it directly under my nose and took a deep whiff. Agony .

name: bixschmix
text:
That's like the first time I ate sushi, when my friend (who also had never eaten sushi) said, "What's that green stuff?" "I don't know..." "Why don't you try it?"

*gulp*

And that's why I don't eat wasabe.

name: awko
text:
I once told a girl that the Japanese consider it an insult if you don't eat the leftover wasabi after your sushi.

The slap I recieved when she found out that this isn't the case was so worth it.

name: myrrdisparo
text: Chubbied so hard for Champ Kind

name: i_love_kate
text:
Oh, wow, is that who that is?

"It kicked up a notch!"

name: ceres
text:
I'm not precisely sure what kind of chocolate it is, but I do know I enjoy 80% pure chocolate. Of course, back in my childhood, or even as a teen, I'd have hated it.

...And I tried those cubes when I was a kid too. It made me sadder but wiser.

name: zapatos
text: I tried to eat styrofoam.  I hear that squeak all the time at work, it is though I have been sent to hell.

name: salo
text:
Awesome!
I thought I was the only idiot who ate a boullion cube and expected the delicious. Usually the exchange goes something like this:
Me: Remember when you were a kid and mistook a boullion cube for candy? Haha, wasn't that rich ?
Other dude: No, that sounds horrible. Go away.

Awkward.

name: saint
text: actually, I enjoy pure vanilla extract by itself.

name: tourach3
text: it's the buzz you never realized was in your kitchen cabinet

name: paco
text: you can get high off of nutmeg

name: envika
text: yes, but it takes a fair amount of it and the effects are generally described as unpleasant

name: heccibiggs
text:
I tried smoking some once, but obviously it wasn't enough to do anything so the only effect it had was tasting really horrible.

Some of the people I was with started going "Oh man, I think I'm tripping..."

No. You're not.

name: i_love_kate
text: Likely one of the seldom-recorded instances of a narcotic placebo in full effect.

name: redzerostar
text: my friends and i snorted some oregano and seasoned salt once. and we were waaaaaaay old enough to know better. like high school. weird things happen when you leave teenage girls alone with kitchen spices.

name: zapatos
text: Too bad they aren't the kinds of weird things I'd hope for.

name: steev_dayv
text: ...with spices.

name: zapatos
text: Yeah that one, I would never lay a finger upon such innocence.  There are other things I'd do with that finger and that innocence however.

name: dracer2
text: I've seen the Spice Channel

name: steev_dayv
text: I've seen the Spice Girls.  Took my sister to a show back in the day.  Fuck.

name: love_is_so_punk
text:
My friend and I snorted powdered wasabi. This was... oh, a couple of months ago I think.

It felt really weird having one nostril burning like a motherfucker so I had to snort some more to make the other one match.

text: thats because its mildly poisonous

name: geesycreesy
text:
I was hoping someone else would catch that!

Now I have a phrase for the next time I hear MF DOOM:
"Rap music, my droogs!"
The dance move seems opptional.

name: yearsinhotclaws
text:
"The dance move seems opptional."

That's where you're wrong!

name: layzerblade
text:
I don't mean to be a dick, but I'd bet 90% of people here "caught" the reference to A Clockwork Orange , and most of us didn't comment on it because it was too obvious.

OK, I do mean to be a dick, but only because you've mistakenly insulted the intelligence of almost everyone who posted above you. What with the book being a very short read, extremely popular and having a well-known movie version, and what with the Acheworld forums having a very high standard of literacy besides, you can rest assured that nearly everyone here knows where the word "droog" comes from.

name: steev_dayv
text: Fuck you.

text: Fuck you, my droogs
